h5database.skeletal package¶

Submodules¶

h5database.skeletal.abstract_extractor module¶

class h5database.skeletal.abstract_extractor.ExtractCallable[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC, collections.abc.Callable, typing.Generic

Superclass of all Callable that extract data (e.g. patches) from the source files. Type order annotated in method type_order. Override get_inputs should manually match the order of data types in patch_group with the given type_order.

KEY_SHAPE = 'data_shape'¶
classmethod background_sanitize(image: numpy.ndarray, sigma: float = 10, smooth_thresh: float = 0.03)[source]¶

Remove the background pixels for tissue slides (set to 0). :param image (): original image. Either gray or RGB. :param sigma (): Radius of the Gaussian kernel. :param smooth_thresh (): Threshold of background mask (smaller-equal)

Returns

image with background pixels set to 0.

Return type

image

abstract static extract(inputs: Tuple[object, ...], type_order: Sequence[str], obj: h5database.database.database.DataExtractor, file: str, data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]], **kwargs) → Tuple[Sequence[Any], Sequence[bool], Sequence[str], object][source]¶

Extraction using the result of “get_inputs”. :param inputs (): Prepared input array obtained from “get_inputs”. :param type_order (): Pre-defined type order of output data. :param obj (): Associated DataExtractor object. :param file (): Path of Source file. :param data_shape (): Shape of data per type. :param **kwargs ():

Returns:

static extract_patch(image: numpy.ndarray, patch_shape: Tuple[int, ...], stride: int, flatten: bool = True)[source]¶
static get_background_by_contrast(img_gray: numpy.ndarray, sigma: float = 10, smooth_thresh: float = 0.03)[source]¶

A naive background/tissue detection by thresholding the mask of Gaussian-smoothed Laplacian mask. Helper function of background_sanitize. :param img_gray (): Grayscale image. :param sigma (): Variance of the Gaussian kernel. :param smooth_thresh (): Threshold of final background mask (smaller-equal)

Returns

background of images. mask: binary mask where nonzero elements represent background region.

Return type

background

abstract static get_inputs(obj: h5database.database.database.DataExtractor, file: str, patch_types: Sequence[str], data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]], **kwargs) → Tuple[object, ...][source]¶

Pre-process the input for the extraction. Method “extract” will be performed on the prepared input. :param obj (): Associated DataExtractor obj. :param file (): Path of the source file. :param patch_types (): Data type names of all target inputs. :param data_shape (): Shapes of data. :param **kwargs (): Keyword arguments.

Keyword Arguments

by obj.meta. Implemented by derived classes. (Given) –

Returns

Input patches group.

classmethod label_key() → str[source]¶

The attribute name of the “label” (output, ground truth, etc.) entity. Must be defined in type_order as well. :returns: The attribute name of the label. :rtype: key (str)

Raises

AssertionError, if not defined in type_order. –

static patch_numbers(patches: numpy.ndarray, n_dims: int = 3) → int[source]¶

Examine the number of patches, if dimensionality is specified. :param patches (): Groups of Patch data. :param n_dims (): Dimensionality. Default 3.

Returns:

abstract static type_order() → Sequence[str][source]¶
Returns

Predefined order of the data types.

static validate_shape(patch_groups: Sequence[Any], type_order: Sequence[str], data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple])[source]¶

Validate whether the shape of each element of the arrays in the patch_groups matches the definition in the dict of data_shape. :param patch_groups (): Sequence of different types of data. i.e. (data_type1_array, data_type2_array, …) Assumption: leading dimension of data_typex_array is the length of the data array. :param type_order (): The order of types of data in patch_groups. :param data_shape (): Dictionary of shape of a single element in the data_array given the type.

Returns: :raises AssertionError if shape does not match:

static validate_type_order(patch_types: Iterable, type_order: Iterable)[source]¶

Raise AssertError if the given patch_types and type_order do not match. :param patch_types (): Given data-type of obtained patch :param type_order (): Predefined data-type for the ExtractCallable.

Returns:
